meanings.definition: The state of being retired from work or active duty.
meanings.sent1: After many years of hard work, his retiredness brought him a sense of peace and relaxation.
meanings.sent2: Her retiredness allowed her to spend more time with her grandchildren and pursue her hobbies.
meanings.sent3: The retiredness of the old sailor led to him spending his days fishing by the lake.
meanings.sent4: The retiredness of the CEO was evident in the way he now spent his days gardening and reading.
meanings.sent5: The retiredness of the teacher was celebrated with a surprise party by her former students.

meanings.definition: The act of withdrawing or moving back.
meanings.sent1: The retiredness of the army troops was a strategic move to regroup and plan their next steps.
meanings.sent2: The retiredness of the ocean waves revealed a hidden treasure washed ashore.
meanings.sent3: The retiredness of the turtle into its shell amused the children watching at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The retiredness of the sun behind the clouds signaled the end of a hot summer day.
meanings.sent5: The retiredness of the car from the busy highway brought a sigh of relief to the driver.
